alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 05 at 9:55PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST FOR SOUTHWESTERN LINCOLN...SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY...NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN...WARREN AND NORTHEASTERN GASCONADE COUNTIES... At 955 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Jonesburg to near Hermann to near Swiss, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jonesburg, Warrenton, Truesdale, Wright City and Innsbrook. This also includes Deutschheim Historic Site. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 188 and 200. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
